meanings.definition: The measurement of the refractive index of a substance.
meanings.sent1: In refractometry, scientists analyze how light bends in different materials.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician used refractometry to find out how light behaves in the liquid.
meanings.sent3: During the experiment, the refractometry machine started telling jokes about light refraction.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a refractometry device, always breaking down complex ideas into simpler forms.
meanings.sent5: The classroom demonstration made refractometry look like a magical way to understand light better.

meanings.definition: The technique or process of determining the refractive index of a substance.
meanings.sent1: Refactometry involves using special tools to measure how light changes direction in a material.
meanings.sent2: Scientists rely on refractometry to figure out the optical properties of various substances.
meanings.sent3: The refractometry procedure turned into a dance routine as the scientist moved the equipment around.
meanings.sent4: His eyes were like refractometry lenses, always seeing things from a different perspective.
meanings.sent5: The art exhibit used refractometry as a theme, showcasing the beauty of light and materials.
